alert.note: Alert for Lipscomb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 3:16AM CDT until September 15 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of the Panhandle of Oklahoma, including the following county, Beaver. Portions of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Lipscomb and Ochiltree. * WHEN...Until 715 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 316 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Booker, Follett, Darrouzett and Slapout. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
